Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant provided sufficient evidence of trademark use under s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Single sale supported by invoices and NAFTA certificates was found genuine and in the normal course of trade
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to demonstrate use of the trademark
Credibility_Factor: Evidence deemed credible and sufficient by the court
Legal_Rule: Under s. 45(1), trademark use must occur at any time during the two years preceding the notice; a single genuine sale in the normal course of trade suffices
Standard_of_Review: De novo review by the court
Procedural_Issue: Failure of original owner to respond to Registrar's notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-use of trademark leading to expungement
Outcome_on_Merits: Appellant succeeded on merits due to proof of genuine use
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Appellant had opportunity to present evidence; process upheld
Key_Evidence_Considered: Invoice and NAFTA certificate for a sale of CASTILLO rum in November 1994
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law, specifically s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging administrative decision to expunge trademark
Defendant_Response: Original owner did not respond to Registrar's notice
Outcome: Trademark use proven; trademark not expunged
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial appeal and de novo review
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks (initial), Court on appeal (final)
Claimant_Status: Appellant as owner or successor of the trademark rights
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark over a three-year period
Applicable_Process: Summary expungement process under s. 45 followed by appeal
Governing_Rule: s. 45(1), Trade-marks Act â€“ requirement for use in the normal course of trade
